text:
Bottle 750ml. @ home. [ As Origame 4 - Session IPA ].ABV: 4.3%. Clear medium orange colour with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, fruity malt, caramel, moderate hoppy, orange, grass, dusty hops. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, fruity malt, orange, fruity, dusty hops, hoppy. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20170612]
 7-3-7-3-15

(Draught at Nüetnigenough, Brussels, 19 May 2017) Hazy brownish amber colour with frothy, beige head. Malty, hoppy nose with toast, orange peel and citrus. Malty, hoppy taste with notes of toast, citrus, roasted malt, resin, dark bread and a balanced citric bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Tasty, but and bit muddy and roasty (might be the last in the keg). Quite nice, though.

Troebel goudblond bier met veel en grote crèmekleurige schuimkraag. Geur: hop! Grassig, den. Smaak: hopbitter, harsachtig. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: bitter, droog. Bier met een lekkere hop beet.

30/11/2016 - draught @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas, Brussels.
Hazy dark yellow, nice creamy white head. Nose is full fruits, passion, pineapple. Taste is also fruits passion, pineapple, some citrus nicely combined with hops bitterness. One of the nicest examples of balance between fruits and bitterness.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Blonde dorée. Nez sublime sur le fruit de la passion et lananas. Palais explosifs, plein darômes, houblon très présent, équilibre parfait, notes de fruits jaunes, fruits exotiques, amertume parfaite. Finale longue et corpulente.

75cl-fles van bij Bierhalle Deconinck te Vichte. U: Troebel goudblond-oranje met zeer grote, stabiele en ivoorkleurige schuimkraag G: Citrus, pompelmoes en sinaasappelschil. S: Bitter, citrusfruitig, pompelmoes. Lichte chemische toets. Een bittere afdronk. M: Stevige carbonatie, goede body.

750 ml bottle. Etre Gourmet. Hazy, blood orange gold. Rocky, frothy, off white head settles to a thin foam. Nose has fruity, blueberry hop. Minty herb. Some sweet flora. Hint of honeysuckle and the like. Some vanilla tinged malts. Taste is light, herby bitter. Touch of honey sweetness. Bright, clean, drying mouthfeel. Light bitter finish, with a drying close. Super tasty for the ABV.

UPDATED: MAY 16, 2017 Robe cuivre, trouble léger. Mousse abondante instable. Nez de houblon fruité et floral. Attaque sèche sur amertume dagrume, notes de citron. Houblon également herbeux et notes florales. Légère douceur se déploie. Belle longueur, très buvable. Corps léger et carbonatation moyenne.

Bottle: Served in a shaker:
Murky orange, fluffy head.
Aroma has a subtle hop acidity with hop fruit and light hop flower tint.
Flavour is hoppy, bitter, citrus and hop fruits, some floral and light yeasty tints.
Aftertaste is bitter hoppy and floral.
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Draft at Gollem, Antwerp. Hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of citrus, fruity hops, light herbs and resinous hop notes. Flavour is above light sweet and over moderate bitter. Light medium bodied with light carbonation.
@ WBF 2015. Hazy yellow, lots of foam. Very dry and bitter with citrussy hops and lemon peel. Dry and grassy, well balanced and easy drinkable. Good beer!

Copper body, fairly clean. Lovely red malts, quite rich for the abv, with pine and sweet tart hops. Bit caramel like too. Punchy bitterness, but quite juicy too, especially towards the end. Lasting taste, I like it a lot! Quality brew for sure and very much a type of beer I enjoy. Another winner from this new (to me at least) brewer. (75cl bottle from Belgian Beer Shop Leuven)

Sample from 75cl bottle.
 Appearance: light clouded blond beer, with a bit to small head
NOSE: hoppy, little dry, fruity, zest 
 TASTE: Moderate bitter and dry. zesty, fruity bitterrness and mild sweetness. Quite dry finish with some yeast tones. 
Thin to Medium body, average carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2015   Bottle from Dranken Geers, Oostakker, Nr Gent, Belgie, consumed at home Saturday 24th October 2015.   We had a Buxton Axe Edge, then a Karl Strauss Big Barrel DIPA , this holds up fantastically well, it reminds me a little of the wonderful Taras Boulba. Wow this is really lively not a gusher as such but it does foam a little. Big hoppy burps aplenty, furry across the roof of the mouth, bloody lovely and a great beer for the abv. A7 A4 T8 P3 Ov16 3.8

Tasted from tap @ brewery when visit on 06.06.15.
Ligth hazy darkgolden color, with a nice creamy white head. 
Aroma: exotic fruits, passion, citrus, grapefruit, sweet note. Medium body. 
Taste: no sweet, plesant exotic fruits, lovely bitterness, bit citrus. 
Finish: grapefruit, bitterness, dry. 
TOP. Most recommend beer of last ZBF.
Bottle bought at Bierhalle Deconinck. Citrus, bitter, hoppy, little metallic, very nice for the ABV.

Sample from 75cl bottle. Thx to Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: light clouded blond beer, almost no head.
NOSE: hoppy, little dry, fruity, rather sweet, caramel.
TASTE: dry, bitter, fruity, nice, but not perfect. Bit too dry in the aftertaste

Slightly hazy warm golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, tropical fruits, hay, malts, light apricot. Bitter hoppy flavour, light malts, tropical fruits. Bitter hoppy finish. Nice!!!!(from draught @ Zythos 2015, Leuven as well as from 75cL bottle @ home - which was slightly more yeasty)

light beige dense head with a very stable head leaves foamhead and structured lacing. orange blonde colour. aroma is hoppy, soapy, floral. taste like aroma, roses with a long bitter finish. rather thin body, very carbonated. expected way more from this. bottle 75cl
Orange voilée, effervescence faible de visu, moyenne au palais, col blanc abondant. Bonne et forte amertume légèrement fruitée dès le départ, un peu herbacée, pelures dagrumes.

25/IV/15 - 75cl bottle @ ZBF 2015 (Leuven) - BB: n/a (2015-465)  Thanks to the Belgian ratebeer crew for sharing todays beers!
Clear blond beer, creamy white dense head, stable, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: bit cheesy, fruity, passion fruit, pineapple, citrus, grapefruit. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very bitter, fruity, little citrus, grassy, dry, slightly medicinal bitterness. Aftertaste: very fruity, citrus, lots of grapefruit, bitter, very bitter and dry. It is of course the first beer of the day, so probably perceived more bitter because of this. Still one of the revelations of the festival!
Bottle 75cl shared with Fabien. Very hoppy and bitter for a session IPA, a bit sweet and quite special at first, but I like it more and more as it gets warmer.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Drunk from 75cl bottle bought at Malting Pot in Brussels. Extremely hoppy bitter pale ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
75 cl bottle. Pours hazy dark orange with a small white head. Aroma is toasted malty, light diacetyl note. Toasted malty, breadish and light malty. Dry and toasted malty finish.
Sampled at ZBF 2015. Hazy golden, medium white head. Tropical fruits, citrus, pine needles. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry, chalky, high bitterness.

(bottle) hazy deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of mango, pale malts and brown sugar, with a hint of floral hops, vanilla and strawberries. flavour is mostly the same, tropical fruits and caramel, with a hint of yeast, pale malts and herbal hops. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.
Fruity and aromatic. Very full flavoured with tropical fruits. A dry and hoppy finish.
Sampled @ ZBF 15. Hazy yellow color, average sized white head. Smell and taste lightly malts, lightly hops, a hint of yeast, lightly fruity. Soft bitter. Not bad.

Excellent discovery at ZBF! I had this one 3 times out of the 15 beers I tasted, so i guess this is a good sign. Very nice hoppy aroma, i reckon some amarillo and cascade..? Very nice fullbodied beer for a session IPA. Nice lingering bitterness and most and for all, no off flavor which is really nice. Keep on eye on this brewery, i think therell be more to come.

One of the beers with which this brewery is now resurrected and likely the first ISA in Belgium; I do find the name "double session IPA" a bit confusing, but according to the brewer, the "double" merely relates to the hops dosage. Sticky, yellowish white, creamy and very stable head, yellowish blonde colour, misty; aroma of tangelo, lemon zest, apple, white grape peel, tonic water, hay. Lightly sweetish onset, vividly fruity, rounded and supple, crisp and quenching, with a long, spicy and restrainedly citrussy hop bitter finish. Very refreshing, no off-flavours, this clearly has been thought out well, and acted out with care and knowledge.

Sampled @ Zyhos Bierfestival 2015

Trübe goldene Farbe, geringe weiße Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, grasig bitter. Geschmack biter hopfig, grasig, Citrusfrüchte.
Heller, sehr bitterer Antrunk. Wenig hefig, Kräuternoten gehen in der Trockenheit unter. Leicht herb halbwegs rund. 11/9/8/8//9

At ZBF 15. Thnx for sharing, everyone ! 
Pours rather unclear blonde, smell is bit bitter and yeasty. Taste is bitter, on a malty backbone. Very hoppy indeed, and it does actually taste like a DIPA. I love this idea and had no clue it was possible ! 
Im a fan, and I hope more beers like this - in this style  will follow !

Sampled 750 ml. bottle @ ZBF 2015. Light golden, little white head. Nose is hazy citrus, touch barnyard hops & light milky yeast. Taste is very dry, hay, rustic, very dry & bitter with some creamy yeast. Very creamy body. Quite nice. That name, it is almost like they googled for popular craft beer terms & just slapped all of them on the bottle. (Thx! for sharing people!)
